headline: Why sports dominate the media industry & what's next in 2026
summary: Paramount (PARA) stock is in focus after the company announced a $7.7 billion deal with TKO Group (TKO) to secure UFC streaming rights. PwC Global entertainment and media leader Bart Spiegel sits down with Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal to discuss why live sports have been a huge focus for media companies. He also discusses what's next in entertainment, including video games and potential deals in the making. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Paramount inks $7.7 billion streaming deal with UFC
summary: STORY: Paramount on Monday said it acquired the exclusive U.S. streaming rights to Ultimate Fighting Championship events in a seven-year deal valued at about $7.7 billion.It's Paramount's first major strategic move since its merger with Skydance just days ago.Starting next year, the company's Paramount+ network will carry the complete U.S. slate of 13 major UFC events and 30 Fight Nights.UFC, which is owned by TKO Group Holdings, will also have select events simulcast on Paramount's CBS network.New Paramount CEO David Ellison called the deal a "major win," while UFC CEO and President Dana White said in a statement that "for the first time ever, fans in the U.S. will have access to all UFC content without a pay-per-view model."Sports content, especially the rights to live events, has become the cornerstone of media companies' strategies as cord-cutting accelerates.Netflix secured a $5 billion, 10-year global deal for WWE Raw and added two NFL Christmas Day games, while Disney's ESPN extended its rights agreements with the NFL, NHL, MLB and the College Football Playoffs.

raw.headline: Paramount inks $7.7 billion streaming deal with UFC
raw.summary: STORY: Paramount on Monday said it acquired the exclusive U.S. streaming rights to Ultimate Fighting Championship events in a seven-year deal valued at about $7.7 billion.It's Paramount's first major strategic move since its merger with Skydance just days ago.Starting next year, the company's Paramount+ network will carry the complete U.S. slate of 13 major UFC events and 30 Fight Nights.UFC, which is owned by TKO Group Holdings, will also have select events simulcast on Paramount's CBS network.New Paramount CEO David Ellison called the deal a "major win," while UFC CEO and President Dana White said in a statement that "for the first time ever, fans in the U.S. will have access to all UFC content without a pay-per-view model."Sports content, especially the rights to live events, has become the cornerstone of media companies' strategies as cord-cutting accelerates.Netflix secured a $5 billion, 10-year global deal for WWE Raw and added two NFL Christmas Day games, while Disney's ESPN extended its rights agreements with the NFL, NHL, MLB and the College Football Playoffs.

headline: Paramount Skydance Strikes $7.7 Billion UFC Deal
summary: Paramount Skydance said it will become the exclusive distributor of TKO Group's UFC events in a seven-year deal worth $7.7 billion.

raw.headline: Paramount Skydance Strikes $7.7 Billion UFC Deal
raw.summary: Paramount Skydance said it will become the exclusive distributor of TKO Group's UFC events in a seven-year deal worth $7.7 billion.

headline: Paramount Stock Falls on UFC Deal. There Could Be More Deals Coming.
summary: Stock in  Paramount Skydance  was down Monday, after the company announced an agreement with  TKO Group Holdings  that will give Paramount exclusive media rights to all Ultimate Fighting Championship events in the U.S.  Paramount, which is formally called Paramount, a Skydance Corporation, also intends to explore acquiring the rights to UFC outside the U.S. in the future.  As part of the agreement, the Paramount+ streaming platform will show UFC’s full slate of numbered events and ‘Fight Nights,’ with select events simulcast on sister network CBS, the companies said.

As part of the agreement, the Paramount+ streaming platform will show UFC’s full slate of numbered events and ‘Fight Nights,’ with select events simulcast on sister network CBS, the companies said.

headline: Paramount Stock Is Rising on Seven-Year UFC Deal. What to Know.
summary: Stock in  Paramount  was rising Monday, after the company announced an agreement with  TKO Group Holdings  that will give Paramount exclusive media rights to all Ultimate Fighting Championship events in the U.S.  Paramount also intends to explore acquiring the rights to UFC outside the U.S. in the future.  As part of the agreement, the Paramount+ streaming platform will show UFC’s full slate of numbered events and ‘Fight Nights,’ with select events simulcast on sister network CBS, the companies said.

As part of the agreement, the Paramount+ streaming platform will show UFC’s full slate of numbered events and ‘Fight Nights,’ with select events simulcast on sister network CBS, the companies said.

headline: Paramount wins exclusive US rights for UFC in $7.7 billion deal
summary: "The addition of UFC's year-round must-watch events to our platforms is a major win," said Paramount CEO David Ellison, former CEO of Skydance, calling the mixed martial arts franchise a "global sports powerhouse".  Under the agreement with UFC owner TKO Group Holdings, streaming service Paramount+ will from next year carry the complete U.S. slate of 13 numbered UFC events and 30 "Fight Nights."

raw.headline: Paramount wins exclusive US rights for UFC in $7.7 billion deal
raw.summary: "The addition of UFC's year-round must-watch events to our platforms is a major win," said Paramount CEO David Ellison, former CEO of Skydance, calling the mixed martial arts franchise a "global sports powerhouse".  Under the agreement with UFC owner TKO Group Holdings, streaming service Paramount+ will from next year carry the complete U.S. slate of 13 numbered UFC events and 30 "Fight Nights."

headline: Paramount secures UFC rights in the US in $7.7 billion deal
summary: Paramount shares were up 4.2% in premarket trading.  The company will carry the UFC's full U.S. slate of 13 numbered events and 30 Fight Nights on its Paramount+ streaming service, with select numbered events simulcast on its CBS broadcast network.  The media company also said it may pursue UFC rights in other markets as they become available.

The media company also said it may pursue UFC rights in other markets as they become available.

headline: PARAMOUNT AND TKO ANNOUNCE HISTORIC UFC MEDIA RIGHTS AGREEMENT
summary: Paramount, a Skydance Corporation, ("Paramount") (NASDAQ: PSKY) and TKO Group Holdings, Inc. ("TKO") (NYSE: TKO), a premium sports and entertainment company, today announced a seven-year media rights agreement in which Paramount will become the exclusive home of all UFC events in the U.S.
